text.div:
DrugTierCS CodeSystem

The drug tier of a particular medication in a health plan. Base set are examples. Each plan may have its own controlled vocabulary.

name: DrugTierCS
title: DrugTierCS
description: The drug tier of a particular medication in a health plan.  Base set are examples.  Each plan may have its own controlled vocabulary.

concept.definition: Generic: Commonly prescribed generic drugs that cost more than drugs in the ‘preferred generic’ tier.
concept.display: Generic: Commonly prescribed generic drugs that cost more than drugs in the ‘preferred generic’ tier.

concept.definition: Preferred Generic: Commonly prescribed generic drugs.
concept.display: Preferred Generic: Commonly prescribed generic drugs.

concept.definition: Non-preferred Generic: Generic drugs that cost more than drugs in ‘generic’ tier.
concept.display: Non-preferred Generic: Generic drugs that cost more than drugs in ‘generic’ tier.

concept.definition: Specialty: Drugs used to treat complex conditions like cancer and multiple sclerosis. They can be generic or brand name, and are typically the most expensive drugs on the formulary.
concept.display: Specialty: Drugs used to treat complex conditions like cancer and multiple sclerosis. They can be generic or brand name, and are typically the most expensive drugs on the formulary.

concept.definition: Brand: Brand name drugs that cost more than ‘preferred brand’ drugs.
concept.display: Brand: Brand name drugs that cost more than ‘preferred brand’ drugs.

concept.definition: Non-preferred Brand: Brand name drugs that cost more than ‘brand’ drugs.
concept.display: Non-preferred Brand: Brand name drugs that cost more than ‘brand’ drugs.

concept.definition: Zero cost-share preventative: Preventive medications and products available at no cost.
concept.display: Zero cost-share preventative: Preventive medications and products available at no cost.

concept.definition: Medical Service: Drugs that must be administered by a clinician or in a facility and may be covered under a medical benefit.
concept.display: Medical Service: Drugs that must be administered by a clinician or in a facility and may be covered under a medical benefit.
